title: Logan Paul claims he is 'drinking the blood of cows' ahead YouTube boxing rematch with KSI
text:
Logan Paul is taking after a Kenyan tribe in his training to rematch rival KSI, turning to cow's blood ahead of his challenge for the YouTube boxing championship.

The Ohio-born vlogger turned fighter faces KSI on November 9th at the Staples Center in Los Angeles. The event that will draw huge numbers through a combined total of more than 52 million subscribers across multiple YouTube channels.

Paul is trained by legendary heavyweight Shannon Briggs, and is many fans' favourite. He managed a majority draw in the pair's first fight on August 25th last year, despite having much less boxing experience than the Brit.

Logan Paul has said he is drinking cows blood in his preparation to rematch KSI in November

The YouTubers last fought in August 2018 to a majority draw - which fans called a fix

Eddie Hearn - who also boasts Anthony Joshua in his stable of fighters- is promoting the clash

The Maasai tribe in Kenya drink the blood of cows on special occasions, as they believe it cleanses the body. It also alleviates hangovers, but Paul believes it can help him get the edge amid his otherwise straightforward regime.

'I'm eating 80lbs a day. I'm drinking the blood of cows and I'm pushing a lot of weights up in the air and putting them down,' Paul told Business Insider.

'They're making a machine out of me. I am sparring professional fighters and I am beating them badly.'

KSI is defending champion, with a stoppage victory over Joe Weller in February 2018 and his Manchester draw with Paul in the 'biggest internet event in history', which earned more than 800,000 pay-per-view buys.

The pair's press conferences are notoriously chaotic, as fellow YouTuber True Geordie hosts

The judges decision led viewers to call for refunds after accusing the pair of fixing the amateur match to setup a second fight - which is set to surpass the last, with Anthony Joshua's promoter Eddie Hearn signing both personalities.

Both men - who also have music careers - are now officially professional boxers, and will ditch the head-guards from their last fight and wear 10oz gloves.

'I love the idea of beating up the person who is trying to beat me up,' Paul added.

'I have been practising with heavier gloves so when I put the smaller ones on, I will be like lightning.'
description: Logan Paul is taking after a Kenyan tribe in his training to rematch rival KSI, turning to cow's blood in the lead up to his bout for the YouTube boxing championship on November 9th.
